example.code:
PS C:\>$option1 = New-Object -TypeName Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\>$option1.Key = "domain-name" PS C:\>$option1.Values = "abc.local"
PS C:\>$option2 = New-Object -TypeName Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\>$option2.Key = "domain-name-servers" PS C:\>$option2.Values = @("10.0.0.101","10.0.0.102") PS C:\>$options = @($option1, $option2)
PS C:\>$DHCPOptions = New-EC2DhcpOption -DhcpConfiguration $options
PS C:\>Register-EC2DhcpOption -DhcpOptionsId $DHCPOptions.DhcpOptionsId -VpcId vpc-f39fcc9b
example.description: Creates a new DHCP Options Set and associates it with vpc-f39fcc9b in the current default region.
